top_categories.workout_context: Marji Gesick’s upper peninsula wilderness, mountain bike/gravel hybrid demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Marji Gesick rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing Marji Gesick isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
At 100 miles, Marji Gesick punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Marji Gesick when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Marji Gesick. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Marji Gesick — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Marji Gesick’s upper peninsula rugged mountain bike/gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Marji Gesick’s 6,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Marji Gesick — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on upper peninsula rugged mountain bike/gravel.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Marji Gesick’s upper peninsula rugged mountain bike/gravel delivers on race day.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Marji Gesick — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Marji Gesick’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Marji Gesick demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride upper peninsula rugged mountain bike/gravel at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: upper peninsula wilderness, mountain bike/gravel hybrid, 100-mile distance. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 100 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 100 miles of upper peninsula rugged mountain bike/gravel in Marquette, Michigan.
